newsitem.title: USA: Comprehensive ex-execs face fraud charges.
newsitem.headline: Comprehensive ex-execs face fraud charges.

text.p: Comprehensive Environmental Systems said Tuesday that its former chief operating offier and a second former executive have been indicted for securities fraud and stock

The company said Leo Mangan, a director and chief operating officer, and James Nearen, a director and special securities council, were indictmented for alleged securities fraud and stock manipulation involving two companies, including Comprehensive Environmental Systems.
Comprehensive said both men left the company on September 12.
The hazardous-waste removal company said it is reviewing "the legal options it may have against Mangan and Nearen as a result of the indictments."
